intro: Stenostomum apiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed waterwheel, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and small, oval leaves that are arranged in whorls. The plant produces tiny, pale yellow flowers that are typically borne in clusters near the water surface. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Stenostomum apiculatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
